🌿✨ FULL DAY OF EATING✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Ive reached my next set of calories during my reverse dieting process, currently on 1800kcals - which you can find more information on in my YouTube series “how to see progress” ❤️🎥 Waffleswithleila ✨ so I thought I’d share with you my full day of eating today and also how you don’t have to be plain Jane when you are trying to shreddy down if thats your goal! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨Breakfast: matcha and raspberry overnight oats bowl cake topped and layered with homemade raspberry chia jam and a square of @fellowcreaturesuk matcha vegan chocolate ✨ for the bowl cake I used 60g oats, 40g @myvegan matcha soy isolate, 5g chia seeds mixed with water until thick consistency. Placed into a bowl overnight. The following morning I flipped onto a plate, cut in half and layered with my homemade raspberry chia jam ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨Pre workout workout snack: whipped coffee! I used a @myproteinuk toffee flavour drop to flavour the almond milk which I heated up! ✨ I also made a single serve blueberry lemon and poppyseed cupcake! ✨ 20g flour, 15g @myproteinuk vanilla soy isolate, 10g sweetener, 1 flax egg (5g grounded flax seeds, with 3 tbsp water) 20ml unsweetened almond milk, 25g unsweetened soy yogurt, 1/4 tsp baking powder, pinch of salt, some lemon juice and poppy seeds ✨ place in a single cupcake case and place into the oven for 20 mins! ✨macros: 194kcals 17C 5F 20P ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨Lunch: tempeh tacos! 1/2 a block of Grilled @plantpowerfoods tempeh, some spinach, black beans, sweetcorn, pickled red cabbage, avocado and a drizzle of unsweetened @alpro soy yogurt ✨ Dessert: @thefitlondoner special; 100g unsweetened soy yogurt topped with 20g cheerios and some frozen raspberries with a drizzle of @myproteinuk sugar free vanilla syrup! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨Dinner: Miso glazed king oyster mushrooms with buckwheat noodles, kale and sweet peppers! For the glaze I used 1/2 tsp miso, some tamari and sugar free syrup. Marinated the mushrooms slices and grilled them! ✨Dessert: a @lotusbiscoffuk sandwich biscuit!✨

🌿✨OREO OATMEAL CHEESLESSCAKE ✨ macros: 556kcals 61C 13F 50P🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ This is for the times when you feeling oreos for breakfast!! I love love love oreos, so this was an absolute dream to wake up to when I made it for the following morning to have! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📖 RECIPE (serves 1:): ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ - 60g oats - 20g @myproteinuk vanilla soy isolate - 20g @myproteinuk dark chocolate vegan blend - 10g chia seeds - 1/2 cup Water for each layer (alternatively your can use almond milk - I ran out on this day) - 50g @alrpo unsweetened soy yogurt - 2 oreos ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👩‍🍳 Method: Gather two bowls to make the different layers. For the first layer mix 30g oats with 20g of protein powder, 5g chia seeds, 1/2 cup water and the same for the following layer. I’m a new dome shaped bowl, place the first layer at the bottom (the dark chocolate layer) and the following layer on top. Place in the fridge overnight to firm. Take out of the fridge the following morning, flip on to a plate, spread on some yogurt sweetened with a @myproteinuk flavour drop, one crusher Oreo and an Oreo on top. The next thing to do is... tuck in 🤤🤤 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Save this recipe, give it a go and Let me know ❤️✨🌿

🌿✨ SINGLE SERVE Peanut butter stuffed Protein Chocolate cupcake topped with homemade protein whip and a @myvegan peanut butter cup! ✨ macros (without the peanut butter cup) : 241kcals 19C 29P 5F ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ It’s allllll well and good baking banana bread, cookies and muffins, until you realise who’s going to eat all of it 😅 baking is so much fun especially in quarantine! It kills time and you get to eat alll the treats!!✨ So I really like to make smaller servings or one servings of things for days where I fancy that one cup cake or one cookie, rather than a big batch!✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📖 RECIPE (serves 1:): - 15g spelt flour, 10g @myvegan vanilla soy isolate, 5g @myproteinuk cacao powder 10g @natvialiving sweetener - 25g unsweetened @alpro soy yogurt, 20ml unsweetened @alpro almond milk, squeeze of a lemon, 1/4 tsp baking powder - 1 flax egg - 5g @linwoodshealthfoods ground flax seeds + 3 tbsp of water mixed together (you can use chia seeds as an alternative) - Peanut butter filling: 10g @myproteinuk powdered peanut butter mixed with 10-20ml water (you can alternately use normal PB but macros will alter) - Chocolate whip: 10g @myvegan dark chocolate vegan blend protein powder, 3g xanthum gum, 30ml water - mixed and whisked with an electrical whisker until thick and peaks formed. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👩‍🍳 Method: Gather two small bowls. Mix the wet and dry ingredients together separately. Combine the two mixtures to form the cupcake batter. Layer some of the batter into a single cup cake case, place on the peanut butter filling and then layer the remaining of the batter on top. Pop in the oven on 180c for 20 mins. In the mean time prepare the protein chocolate whip. Leave the cupcake to cool out of the oven, pop on the whip and top with whatever you like! Chocolate chips, sprinkles, berries! I topped mine with a @myvegan peanut butter cup! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Save this recipe, give it a go and Let me know ❤️✨🌿

🌿✨Happy hump day all! Just a little reminder that it’s so fabulous to work towards and achieve your own personal aesthetic goals, but it’s not okay to not respect and love yourself during the process! ❤️ ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Loving yourself, taking care of yourself, respecting yourself is the best thing you can do! It’s completely fine to want to make a change, but for the right reasons! Not trying to find a way to “quickly” see results because it doesn’t work like that! You should really be enjoying what you choose to do, not force yourself! Love eating the way you do, love exercising the way you do, because it makes you happy ❤️ Choose your own pathway rather than trying to copy others!! I’ve been there in the past, trying to find the WORLDS BEST DIET , trust me, theyre all useless, waste of time and damaging. I learnt that nothing long term and sustainable, comes quickly. The more slow controlled it is, the more enjoyable and sustainable it is! ✨ The sooner I jumped on board with that correlation, I never questioned the way I choose to eat, exercise or reach a goal! ✨SENDING BUCKETS FULL OF LOVE TO YOU ALL!! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Wearing: @doyoueven @doyouevenwomen - links in my bio with a 10% automated discount link ✨🌿

🌿✨ Vegan Chocolate Babka protein slices! ✨ Macros per slice: 161kcals 23C 14P 1.4F ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ A weekend in quarantine leads to baking many different things right? 🙃 I came up with this yummy chocolate swirl bread using @sweetfreedomuk chocolate sauces! They’re a yummy little snack and high in protein too✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📖 RECIPE (serves 10:): ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ - 250g spelt flour (or alternative- keep some on the side for kneading) ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ - 100g @myproteinuk vanilla soy isolate ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀⠀- 150ml @alpro unsweetened almond milk (or alternative) ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀⠀ - 70g @alpro unsweetened soy yogurt (or alternative) ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀⠀ - 60g @myproteinuk sugar free syrup (or alternative) ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀⠀ - 15g fast activating yeast ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀⠀ - For the filling: 80g @sweetfreedomuk choc shot ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👩‍🍳 Method: Stir the wet ingredients together with the yeast. Stir the dry ingredients together. Combine the two mixtures. Knead into a dough. Roll out into a thin rectangle. Spread on the filling. Roll the dough and filling length way into a cylinder. Leave a piece at the top for concealment and respectively cut down the middle. You should be left with two pieces of dough held together by the uncut piece of dough at the top. Plait/ twists the two piece of dough together to form the desired shape. Place in a bread tin lined with baking paper and bake in the oven for 30 mins on 180c. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Save this recipe, give it a go and Let me know ❤️✨ #babka #veganbread ✨🌿

🌿✨ Game time for my workout budddies!! Loved this little idea from one of the girlies @fittolift ❤️ let me know your answers down below or in your own caption!! ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1. Pre workout or no? can’t say I’m a fan of pre workout, the caffeine content in it makes me go loo loo! A simple coffee with a @myproteinuk flavour drop is enough to help power me through a workout! But I always have a meal or snack before a workout any way ✌🏼 2. Upper or lower bod session? Although I love a 🍑, I love love love training upper body - I’ve recently seen so much progression through my upper body and I’m really happy with it as it’s something I’ve always been conscious about! 💪🏼 3. One food you couldn’t live without? Porridge!!! Oats!! Oatmeal!! Anything and everything to do with a big bowl of oats 🤤 if I had to have it for breakfast everyday! I would!!! 4. Team sweet or savoury? Sccchweeet all day erryday ✌🏼 5. Squats or deadlifts? Much prefer deadlifts! My knees tend to give way more easily with squats! 6. Morning or evening sesh ? Morning workouts always! Sets me up for the day, makes me feel more energised 💪🏼 7. LISS cardio or HIIT? Love love love a good walk everyday, listening to music and podscasts! I’d choose LISS (walking or cycling- I can’t run) over HIIT, but I love HIIT for the reason being - it’s more intense over a shorter period of time 8. Where are you from? I’m half British/ half Lebanese! My mum is English 🇬🇧 and my dad is fully Lebanese! 🇱🇧 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Id love to know your answers! Tag me in your posts or write them in the comment section down below 🥰 wearing @doyouevenwomen @doyoueven ✨🌿

🌿✨ Bank holiday ✅✨ What have you all been up to today? 🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨As I mentioned previously, I love planning my day ahead as I don’t get many days off during the week, so when I do have days off, it’s a great chance for me to catch up with things! ✨I particularly love love love the days off I have to be more creative with my meals, especially because there’s more time in the day to be creative! ✨ Today I woke up 5:30am, got my 30 mins morning LISS cardio in on my treadmill, had my breakfast, chillaxed for a hot minute, edited l my YouTube upload for tomorrow, made a recipe up and ate it for my pre workout snack, got in a lower bod workout, had lunch, prepped my meals, and planned my working week ahead! I then went for a walk with my family through our local park, had dinner and now I’m relaxing ✌🏼 aka laying on my bed like a starfish watching YouTube videos! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🏋🏻‍♀️ Lower bod Workout : ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ - 5 min Stretch ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀ ⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀- 5 min Glute activation (can be found on my story highlights) ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀ ⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀ - 3x10 RB BB split squats ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀ ⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀ - 4x10 DB Hack squats ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀ ⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀ - 3x10 BB front squats ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀ ⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀ - 4x10 Good mornings SSW/ Hamstring ball curls ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀ ⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀ - 4x10 BB RB Kneeling squats ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨Workout courtesy of @armandocantore as part of his 12 week DB and BB home workout guide! 🌿✨🐰 Protein Hot cross bun scones ✨ Macros per scone: 217kcals 35C 2F 15P🐣✨ @natvialiving #gifted #ad ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Happy easter weekend all! What have you got planned to do indoors? Easter is usually a time for family gatherings, eating all the Easter eggs and making memories, so although it will be a difficult time knowing that this year it won’t be the same, it doesn’t mean you can’t have an Easter to remember! How about video call all your family members at a certain time suitable for everyone? You can still munch on your Easter egg (you can’t avoid that one) 🙃 orrr you could get up to see Easter baking! Make your own choc Easter egg, hot cross bun or how about some fudge? I made these hot cross buns into scones! They’re super yummy to cut in half and fill with some jam as a little Easter snack!!✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📖 RECIPE (serves 6): ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ - 200g spelt flour (or alternative - not coconut or almond) - 60g @myvegan vanilla soy isolate - 50g @natvialiving sugar free sugar - 50g raisins - 150g unsweetened soy yogurt - 170ml almond milk - 1/4 cup water - 1/2 tsp fast activating yeast - Some cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger and all spice, some baking powder and a dash of salt. - For the crosses: 40g flour, 20-30ml water ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👩‍🍳 Method: combine the yogurt, almond milk and water together. Stir in the yeast, sugar and a dash of salt. Allow to settle for 5 mins. Add the flour, protein powder (leave some flour for kneading the dough) , spice mix and raisins. Form into a ball of dough and knead on a non stick surface. Place back into the bowl and cover with a damp cloth. Leave to for the yeast to activate for 30mins. Afterwards, form into 6 smaller balls and place into a baking tray lined with baking paper. To make the crosses, combine the two ingredients (sticky job) and place on top of each bun forming crosses. Place in the oven to bake for 20 mins and tuck in 👏🏼 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Save this recipe, give it a go and Let me know ❤️✨🌿

🌿✨FULL DAY OF EATING ✌🏼 ✨ Another Full day of eating! Considering so many found others I’ve made helpful, I thought I’d try to post them weekly! As usual, be aware that what I eat changes, purely because what I may fancy on a particular day changes! So here’s what I had on a particular day! ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Breakfast: 50g oars, 1 scoop of @myproteinuk dark chocolate vegan blend, 5g chia seeds and half a grated courgette mixed with water, topped with 1/2 a banana, 1 tbsp @manilife_ peanut butter, homemade proteinola (recipe in my ebook) and @fellowcreatures vegan milky chocolate ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Pre workout (253kcals 35C 4F 18P) : homemade blueberry pop tart - for the pastry; 40g flour, 10g @myproteinuk vanilla soy isolate , 50g @alpro unsweetened yogurt , 20ml water, some baking powder and salt. for the blueberry chia jam filling: 100g frozen blueberries mixed in a pot with 5g chia seeds until stewed. Mix the ingredients for the filling to form a dough, roll out and cut in 2 rectangular halves. Place the filling in the centre and the halves on top of each other. Bake in the oven for 15 mins on 180c ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Lunch: Homemade Butternut squash and tofu curry with quinoa, spinach, sweet pepper and homemade naan bread: 40g spelt flour mixed with 1/2 tsp yeast, some salt, 1tbsp water, 1 tbsp stevia, and 15g yogurt. Mix together, roll out into a naan bread shape and place on a baking tray for 15 mins of 180c ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Snack: Strawberry protein smoothie - 100g frozen strawberries, half a scoop of @myproteinuk strawberry protein powder, 1 cup almond milk ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Dinner: kale, red cabbage, half an avocado soy mince and homemade chickpea, sweetcorn and courgette fritters - it’s essentially the recipe for my chickpea omelette, in my ebook and then I added the sweetcorn and grated courgette into the mix to form fritters! ✨ ✨ Snack: Homemade chocolate and orange Babka protein slice - I’ll be sharing the recipe soon! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Save these recipes and let me know if you give any a go ❤️✨🌿

🌿✨ Homemade Chocolate Peanut Butter Easter Eggs! ✨ Macros per egg: 122kcals 7C 8P 6F ✨ featuring @myproteinuk peanut butter powder and sugar free syrup!! At 9am today my discount code gets you an extra % off all their products for their Easter sale!! Use my discount code and link in my bio 🐰🐣✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 😅 Who needs to pop to the shops for Easter eggs when you can #stayhome and make them yourself!! Great value for time and money ✅✅ I made these yummy choc peanut butter filled eggs the other weekend and I’ve been having them to snack on throughout the week! But can you imagine them dipped in oats? 🤔😍👏🏼✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📖 RECIPE (serves 10): ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ - For the Peanut butter filling: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 100g @myproteinuk powdered peanut butter (can be substituted for usual peanut butter - but the macros will change respectively), 7g coconut oil, 15g @myproteinuk sugar free syrup, 30g @myproteinuk vanilla soy isolate protein (or an alternative vegan blend) and 1/2 a cup of water ⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀ - For the chocolate coating: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 100g dark melting chocolate, 7g coconut oil ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👩‍🍳 Method: start by making the filling by mixing all of the ingredients together in a bowl (melt the coconut oil before mixing). Once combined, shape into Easter eggs and pop into the fridge to firm up for 20-30 mins. In the mean time, prepare the chocolate coating by combing and melting the two ingredients respectively. Take the peanut butter eggs out of the fridge, dip into the melted chocolate and place them on the wrack to harden. The temperature difference between the eggs and the chocolate coating, allows the chocolate to harden quicker, if not, allow them to harden in the fridge for another 10 mins... alternatively you can go rouge and just gobble some up straight away 🙃🙃🙃 Store them in the fridge, they can last for up to week!! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Save this recipe, give it a go and Let me know ❤️ ✨ #easter #chocolate #chocolateegg ✨🌿

🌿✨ Staying motivated and Managing my time! Swipe for he reality of my life right now! 💀 🏥 ✨🌿 ✨ So this week I’m doing three 12 hour shifts in A&E which means I work 3 days during the week and I have 4 days off! I’ll be training 5 times this week as oppose to 6 times, mainly because the stress those shifts have on my body and the 2 days of rest really help! ✨ My training split will consist of 3 lower bod days and 2 upper bod days with 3 core sessions, 2 HIIT sessions and LISS cardio (step goal 15-25k) during the week ✨ Ways that set me up for the start until the end of the week, to keep me motivated and focused include: 👉🏼Scheduling and writing up my workouts for each day of the week. 👉🏼Having an idea of what I’d like to have for each meal during the week (untracked) just so that I can do one weekly food shop rather than several times during the week. 👉🏼 The night before each day - I track my meals. If it’s the day before a working day during long day shifts I prep it the day before, if it’s a day before during normal shifts, I prep the majority of the meals at the start of the week so that I can just grab and go healthy homemade meals each day without relying on convenience. 👉🏼Writing up a weekly/ daily to do list in my planner to know certain tasks that I wish to complete for each day - maximum of 3 to ensure that I can manage my time efficiently and allow myself rest at the same time whilst I’m off work. 👉🏼Each day, from when I wake up to when I go to bed I write up what I’d like to do each hour of the day so that I can get more things done in the day and so that I still have a routine and structure during the week! 👉🏼 The day before each day, I also lay out my gym kit - I don’t consider training at home an excuse to wear pjammys as I find that I feel less dedicated to work out, so I separate my pjammys, from my gymwear to the clothing I wear during the day, so that my mind can differentiate between everything more easier whilst staying at home! 🌿✨Off for the remaining of this week, working Sat and Sun! Luckily London has blessed us with good weather the days I’m off! ✨ Wearing @officialmp @myproteinuk loungewear - links in my bio with a discount code ❤️✨🌿

🌿✨ Carrot matcha garden patch oatmeal bowl 🐰 🥕 ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 🙃 You’ll have to be imaginative with this one!! I made a yummy matcha and carrot oatmeal bowl in my @shopcocabana coconut bowl topped with choc bunnies, one crushed weetabix and blueberries! ✨ Even though were all isolating, Easter is still happening - which means loads of choccc melts in bowls of oats 🤤 ✨ For the oatmeal bowl I used: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ - 60g oats - 1 scoop of @myvegan matcha soy isolate - 5g @myproteinuk chia seeds - 1 cup almond milk - A grated carrot 🥕 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ I like to cook my oatmeal in a pot on a stove! I find that the protein doesn’t clump and the oats are more creamier, as oppose to heating it all in a microwave! Another way you can prevent clumping is mix the liquid with the protein powder initially until smooth and then combine with the remaining ingredients in the pot! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Currently in my way to work to start my 12 hour shift, meals and snacks ready to set me up for the day and power through!! What have you planned to do today? Let me know ❤️😌 Use LHMYP for 37% off @myvegan @myproteinuk products! My ambassador link is in my bio ✨🌿

🌿✨ ‘Time to support each other’ ❤️ Happy monday! ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Good afternoon all! 🌿✨ Vegan quesadillas 🤤✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Simple lunches/dinners are sometimes the most yummiest ✨ especially when you just want to whip up something quick! ✨ I made these in one of my recent YouTube videos! 👏🏼 so simple to make ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📖 RECIPE: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ - 2 mini soft tortillas - 50g soy mince - 60g blackbeans - 1/2 a sliced red onion - 80g tomato sauce - Slice of @violife_foods cheese ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👩‍🍳 Method: mix the soy mince, red onion, black beans, and tomato sauce together in a pan. In a separate pan, toast one half of the soft tortillas! Place the filling on top of the first soft tortilla and follow by placing the slice of cheese and other tortilla on top! Flip to toast on the other side and allow the cheese to melt. Cut into quarters and enjoy!! I topped mine with some avo too 🥑 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Save this recipe, give it a go and Let me know ❤️✨ Have a fabulous Sunday!! I hope the day brings you positive vibes , productivity and some goood British weather 👏🏼✨ #stayhome ✨🌿

🌿✨ If you can’t remember my name, just say hummus and I’ll turn around 🤣🙃✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Seriously loving this combo at the minute! I sautéed some mushrooms in 1 tsp of agave nectar, tamari (can be substituted for soy sauce or coconut aminos) paprika, cayenne pepper, onion and garlic powder. I then placed it on top of a bagel spread with a layer of hummus and the two together is sooo good! Highly recommended! I also sprinkled some sesame seeds on top - partially because it made the dish look prettier ( #guilty ) but also because I love sesame, especially tahini!! ✨ Bowl details? I served the bagel for my lunch with some kale, Pickled red cabbage, and grilled tofu! I get my tofu from @tofooco which you can buy in most stores and I grill it in my @georgeforemanuk grill - no oil or anything, I just love the flavour of it plain when grilled 🤤👏🏼✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Who else is a fan of hummus? I know this is a no brainer for @healthycrazycool 🤣 Ooooooo! Let me know 🥰❤️✨🌿

🌿✨ Salted Caramel cookie Hot Cross bun explosion! Macros: 554kcals 85C 34P 11F ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Bit of a story behind this one 😅 so @greggs_official kindly gifted my department in hospital some of their bakes - one of which included their vegan hot cross buns which I’ve been meaning to try, So I took one home! The following morning I whacked this up to have for breakfast because I actually dreamt of a hot cross bun stuffed with a cookie 🙃🙃 I can confirm it bangs 👏🏼 especially layered with @myproteinuk powdered peanut butter and the @myvegan goey salted caramel cookie!! ✨ Dreaming of sleeping like a baby? @melacomfort makes that more possible than ever with their weighted blankets! #gifted #ad ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Weighted blankets are a natural side that can help you sleep better while easing the feelings that come with anxiety, depression, stress and insomnia! They’re heavier than normal blankets and come in a variety of sizes and should be roughly 10% of your bodyweight. How do they work? They imitate deep pressure touch simulation - much like a massage or a hug! They have a calming soothing effect on people’s mood and is actually the same science behind why we swaddle babies! The benefits to using a weighted blanket include improving you sleep, stress or anxiety whilst enabling you to perform at your best ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ My favourite thing about the @melacomfort blanket is that the added weight of their ultra soft blanket, that mimics the feeling of being held or hugged! ✨ There was even a study conducted amongst participants who slept with a weighted blanket, and it was noted that their sleep was more comfortable and deeper as a result! ✨ From a few days experience myself, the blanket is super comforting and makes me feel calm throughout the night! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ @Melacomfort have a 25% discount for all you lovelies that want to improve your sleep and wellbeing! The link is on my stories with a swipe up! Message me if you need any help/ questions about the blanket or access to the link! ❤✨🌿

🌿✨ Vegan Protein Chocolate Cream Egg cake! ✨ Macros: 561 69C 13F 40P ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨🐰 Since it’s now April, it’s more than acceptable to eat all the Easter chocolates now right? 🙃 How about inside a cake! I used the @mummymeagz vegan chocolate eggs to stuff inside my chocolate mug cake recipe so it melts inside! It was incredible 😍👏🏼 I found the vegan chocolate egg in @hollandandbarrett although I had to make several trips because on several occasions they were out of stock 😅 defo recommend!! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📖 RECIPE: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ - 60g spelt flour - 30g dark chocolate @myvegan vegan blend protein powder - 5g flax seeds - 5g cacao powder - 150ml almond milk - 1/2 tsp baking powder, squeeze of half a lemon - 1 chocolate cream egg ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👩‍🍳 Method: combine all of the ingredients together in a microwavable safe bowl. Pop the cream egg within the centre of the cake batter. Place into the microwave for 3 mins! Flip the mug cake on to a plate to reveal the chocolatenessss 😍👏🏼 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ What’s your favourite chocolate at Easter time? Let me know ❤️✨🌿

🌿✨ Mini Hassleback potatoes with chilli con carne, a side of greens and unsweetened so yogurt! ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ A yummy and nutritious Lunch/Dinner options, providing all the essential macro and micronutrients! ✨ White or Sweet potatoes? ✨  There’s a common misconception that one is better than the other, when it’s not the case! It’s just that white potatoes are deemed less “healthy” due to how it’s typically usually used, Ie. fries 🍟 Although it’s quite popular to find sweet potato fries nowadays too! But even then, people think that the sweet potato fries would be the “better” option. Actually, the sweet potato fries tend to be more calorific . White potatoes and sweet potatoes have complementary nutritional differences; one isn’t necessarily better than the other. For instance, sweet potatoes have more fiber and vitamin A, but white potatoes are higher in essential minerals, such as iron, magnesium, and potassium. Ultimately, the type of potato you have in your meal is completely down to preference! ✨ To make the hassleback potatoes, I made small slits with a knife and sprayed with some fry light oil, placed in the oven for 30 mins to back and crispen! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Which potato forever you prefer? White or sweet!? Let me know ❤️✨🌿

🌿✨ Swipeee for the creaaaminesss! ✨High protein Vegan Cookie Dough 💪🏼🍪 Macros: 486kcals 47C 46P 11F ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Thick, creamy, delicious and nutritious 🤤 This cookie dough is from my ebook and is made out of chickpeas! ✨ The great thing about recipes like these in my ebook, is that you can combine them into different recipes! For example, if I wanted, I would half the portion, make some pancakes from my ebook and layer the cookie dough between the pancakes 🥞 to form cookie dough pancakes 🤤👏🏼 You can also adapt the recipe to make it as a snack - all you need to do is half the portion! ✨ I love the creaminess, sweetness and overall texture of the cookie dough in my mouth and I know it’s full of nutrients and something that will satiate my hunger due to the high protein content and sweet tooth due to the deliciousnessssss! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨The link for my ebook is in my bio! 🌿✨ Vegan ribs? 🤪 loving these tempeh bbq ribs from @plantpowerfoods ✨ Happy monday all! Did anyone else think that this Sunday felt like the sunday-ist of sundays, of all sundays ever? 🙃🙃🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Yesterdays lunch was super delicious! If you asked me what my favourite vegan sources of protein are, tempeh would definitely be one of them! I also love love love tofu, seitan and soy mince! ✨ Tofu and tempeh are much more accessible in larger supermarkets nowadays, where as seitan isn’t so much! I usually have to source that, if I fancy it, from places like planet organic or the whole foods store! ✨ However, seitan can actually be homemade, as it’s made from wheat, so I may be an experimental bean and try and make my own sometime 😅 Had anyone made there own seitan before? ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Alsoooo, my new YouTube video is now live on my channel! “Instagram decides what I eat in a day” - I really enjoyed making this video!! A lot of the suggestions were sooo yummy and amazing - and the ones selected for the video, were fabulous 👏🏼👏🏼 check out the video for some meal ideas and little life updates! ❤️🎥 Waffleswithleila 🎥❤️ Let me know what you think! ✨🌿

🌿✨Training update | What am I doing differently? ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ I’ve fully accepted that gyms are not going to be open for a fair while but it will only be temporary! Going to the gym, lifting weights, and just exercise in general, is a big part of my life! So I didn’t see closure of the gyms as an opportunity to drop that part of my life! I’ve just adapted my technique so that I could carry on with what I love!✨ I’m incredibly grateful and fortunate enough to have the equipment that I do have in my room ( very old equipment from previous years - I bought them from Argos) because I know it’s a real struggle/ not practical to buy a bundle of equipment just for a short period of time! ✨ But that doesn’t mean you’ll loose muscle or what you’ve achieved in the gym! Your body is a clever little thing and has muscle memory! What you need to make sure you’re doing is creating a constant stimulus for muscle fibres to break during your workouts, refuelling your bod with food to rebuild and repeat! ✨ So you may not have the equipment but you can use hypertrophic/ endurance training to have a similar effect! ✨ When the gyms reopen - you may not be at the strength you were currently at but you wouldn’t of lost it completely, it will just take some time after! ✨ Here’s my home workout adapted, current split during the week: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ - 6 workouts a week in total - 15k-25k step goal range - Mon - legs - Tue - upper, core, HIIT - Wed - legs - Thur - upper, core, HIIT - Fri - legs - Sat - Full body routine/ workout video/ yoga - Sun - active rest day, stretching ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ My calories are still at 1900kcals in total until next week, as it would be the fortnightly drop in my reverse diet phase where I’ll go down to 1850kcals - for more information on how to figure out your personal macros, reverse dieting and more, head over to my YouTube playlist “how to see progress” at Waffleswithleila ❤️ 🎥✨Lwt me know what your current workout split is? ✨ Wearing: @doyoueven @doyouevenwomen #doyouevenwomen ✨🌿

🌿✨ Choco melt oats!! 🤤 ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ I really don’t think you can beat melting chocolate in a bowl of oats, and as it becomes closer and closer to Easter, you know it will be happening a lot more often 🙃🙃 What’s your favourite chocolate to melt in oats? I loveee these new vegan chocolate bars by @loveraw they’re so creamy and melt like a dream 😍 #gifted ! In this @shopcocabana coconut bowl I have 65g oats, 1 scoop of dark chocolate @myvegan blend protein powder, 1/2 a grated courgette, 300ml almond milk 5g chia seeds and 5g cacao powder ! Topped with the chocolate bar, banana slices, blueberries, some cacao nibs, shredded coconut and chocolate soy Krispies from @koro_uk ✨ Just out of curiosity, how do you like to cook your oats, on the stove or in the microwave? I much prefer on the stove! They come out so much more creamier and I find that the protein combines better! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Today’s plans consist of attempting a food shop at Tesco’s 😅 who else feels a bit resistant towards a food shop nowadays? It’s just manic! Luckily they have a browsing hour at 10am on a Sunday for NHS staff, so I’ll be making full use of that 👏🏼✨ I’ll also be prepping my week for the meals ahead, editing a YouTube video and spending time with my family... probably grace trying to make me do another tik tok dance with her 🤣✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Rest day for me today, but I’ll be making sure that I’m getting 15k + steps in (my daily step goals) and some mobility work to set me up for a good week of home workouts ahead! ✨ Have a fabulous Sunday all! ❤️ Let me know what you’ve got planned for today? ✨🌿

🌿✨ Full day of eating and physique update!✨ If you’re an OG you’ll know how frequently I used to post the same layout as this when I first started my fitness journey! 😅 I thought I’d reintroduce it as I know people found it helpful in terms of meal ideas ✨ As I always mentioned in the past, my calories are calories specific requirements for my bod and own self! So me sharing them to you, shouldn’t be an opportunity to copy them! ✨ As I’ve addressed in my previous YouTube videos with a proper explanation of the process, I’m currently still reverse dieting down into my caloric deficit kcals! ✨ Where as before I had to go quite low for my bod to get to a leaner structure, my metabolism has adapted respectively, therefore I don’t need to go as low as I did (1650kcals) - please be aware of the process of reverse dieting! ✨ So during my build I went up to 2150kcals, I then at the end of it, every fortnight I reduced by 50 kcals, which has lead to my current kcals of 1900kcals - my plan is to continue doing so until I reach my lowest cutting kcals for this year of 1700kcals! ✨ The reasoning im sharing my specific kcals is because people assume that you have to eat extremely low when wanting to achieve a leaner physique, when it’s actually the complete opposite! Your body needs energy to fuel processes, when you go to low, your metabolism dramatically slows down and so it’s harder for you to reach your goals! ✨ Also, please note, what I eat in a day typically changes on a day to day basis! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ On this particular day, I trained in the morning so as my 🍽 pre workout snack I had a homemade protein cinnamon swirl - which was a recipe I halved from my ebook! 🍽 Breakfast- pumpkin cookie dough (also in my ebook) topped with salted caramel popcorn 🍽 Mid morning snack - @loveraw salted caramel chocolate bar 🍽 Lunch - smashed avo on toast, @lindamccartneyfoods chorizo sausages, cucumber, carrots, kale, alfalfa sprouts and sourdough croutons 🍽 Dessert - lotus seed pops and blueberries 🍽 Dinner - spinach, tofu, sweet potato, roasted courgette and turmeric cauliflower , pickled red cabbage and hummus 🍽 Dessert - milky tumeric tea ✨🌿

🌿✨ 5 QUARANTINE TIPS ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Its quite easy to fall out of routine when your at home everyday! ✨ I’ve never been so fortunate to still be able to go to work knowing that I’m helping a good cause! But I know for a lot of you, going to work is out of the question ✨ This is our new normal and I’ve finally excepted it! ✨ I thought it would be super helpful to share some tips during these uncertain times and offer some reassurance! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ Stick to a routine - everyday, the night before, write up a schedule for the following day. From the minute until you wake up until you head off to bed! I do this in my day to day life either way, but I find it really helps motivate me to get up and move so I’m able to do more things in the day! 2️⃣ Set yourself a focus for the day - writing an intention for each day can help with working towards a goal. Eg. Being active and staying hydrated! I suggest focusing on staying active everyday - whether that be incorporating some interval training, resistance or functional, maybe a walk in the park or on a treadmill, some Pilates or yoga - anything to get the blood circulating and increase your pulse rate! 3️⃣ When you split your day make sure you incorporate your meals including breakfast lunch, dinner and snacks - I would suggest writing a food diary and know what you’re eating each day - that way you’ll stay accountable and not snacking recklessly throughout the day (easily done)!! 4️⃣ Ensure that your meals contain a distributed amount of macro and micronutrients! It’s so important to focus on your nutrition during this time when it comes to the goals you had set yourself before this madness came about - whether that be being in a caloric surplus or deficit! 5️⃣ Meditate! I know for some this can be difficult or is a bit wishy washy! But meditation is great for stress relief! Challenge your self to set 10-15 mins aside for stillness and mindfulness to ease your thoughts and to relax! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Hope this helps!! Write your top tips down below/ what you’ve been doing during these very odd times so others can read! ✨@pursuefitness ✨🌿

🌿✨ Homemade courgette vegan lasagna and garlic butter dough balls 🤤 quarantine and comfort ✌🏼✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ During this time, focusing on nourishing your bod with yummy and nutrient dense food is key! You can easily fall into the trap of being at home all day everyday and eat your way through the day! Take the time to listen to your body and hunger que! It’s vital to fuel your body with its specific needs! I’ve been filming my weekend and have been discussing key topics I’ve been asked such as gym anxiety, fear of gaining weight and etc. ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📖 RECIPE : ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ For the lasagna (macros: 208kcals 20C 6F 17P) you’ll need 1 courgette, 80g soy mince, 100g tomato sauce, some spinach, 20g vegan grated cheese! Firstly, mix the soy mince, tomato sauce and spinach in a pot and allow to cook. Slice the courgette into thin slices and place the first layer at the bottom of a single serve baking tray. When cooked, layer the soy mince, tomato sauce and spinach between the courgette sheets, top with the vegan cheese and place in the oven for 20 mins. Served with green beans and my dough balls 👇🏼 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ For the dough balls (macros: 237kcals 26C 7F 16P) ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 40g spelt flour, 10g protein powder ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 40g unsweetened soy yogurt ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 7g vegan butter mixed with 1/2 tsp garlic powder ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👩‍🍳 METHOD: mix the dough ingredients together, separate into 2 portions , flatten and spread the garlic butter - then roll into two balls! Pop onto a baking tray lined with baking paper in the oven for 20 mins! Take out the oven and feast!! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Save this recipe and let me know if you give it a go ❤️ I’d love to know and see your recreations!! ✨ #vegan #plantbased #veganfood #veganlunch #vegandinner #veganmeals #mealideas #lunchideas #dinnerideas #veganrecpies #covid #coronavirus #quarantine ✨🌿

🌿✨ SWIPE FOR A HOME LEG WORKOUT✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ As addressed and broadcasted yesterday, all gyms in the U.K. have now closed and although it’s disappointing, disheartening and overwhelming, it is a step in the right direction! I continued to go because I just had a feeling they’d close soon so I was just trying to make the most out of hitting my PBs and all! However, it’s not the end! I will be keeping to my routine and updating you guys on here! I’ll be using higher rep and set ranges in my training to meet the intensity I perform at the gym with heavier lifts! ✨After hearing the news yesterday, I quickly revamped my room into a mini gym 🤣🤣 thank god I saved all the equipment I bought yearssss ago because trying to find gym equipment now is non existent! Everything is sold out!! ✨ Today was a leg day and surprisingly, although my lifts were less in weight - I felt challenged, this is what I did!✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉🏼 BB squats 4x20 👉🏼 KB RDLS 4x 15 👉🏼 Single leg RDLS 4x15 👉🏼 OH DB lunges 4x15 per leg 👉🏼 Weighted Wall sits 30 secs Ssw/ RB glute abductions 4x20 👉🏼RB weighted gluted bridges ssw/ RB Single Glute bridges 4x20 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ I know this can be a nervous and anxious time for a lot of us but just know it’s temporary and we’re in this together ❤️ I’ll be documenting all my thoughts and little tips in my YouTube video I’m filming this weekend - I’ll upload on Monday! ✨WHAT DID YOU TRAIN TODAY? ✨ wearing @myproteinuk @officialmp ✨ #homeworkout #workouts #quarantineworkout #fitness #fit #legworkoutathome #homeexercise #exercise #legworkout #athome #training #workout ✨🌿

🌿✨ VEGAN PIZZA PROTEIN SCROLLS✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Since we all have a lot more time on our hands, creativity through food is one way to have fun, feed our souls, mind and tummies!! I made these yummy pizza scrolls which are decently high in protein and super delicious! Find the recipe below!! You can have them individually or all at once, as I like to make my food macro friendly, ie. more for less = volume! ✅✅ id say I was challenging @papajohnsuk on this with their vegan pizza scrolls 😎 have you tried them? ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📖 RECIPE (Total Macros: 297kcals 38C 8F 19P - makes 6 scrolls - per scroll - 50kcals 6C 1F 3P): ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 50g spelt flour ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 10g @myproteinuk soy protein unflavoured protein powder - (but a vanilla flavoured powder could work aswell! I don’t use whey so I won’t know if it would work still!) ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 60g yogurt ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 1/2 tsp baking powder ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨1 tbsp tomato purée, 20g @violife_foods grated cheese ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👩‍🍳 METHOD: mix the dough ingredients together, roll out into a long wide rectangle, cut lengthwise into skinny long rectangles! Place on top the tomato purée and grated cheese! Roll into circles! Pop on to a baking tray lined with baking paper in the oven for 20 mins! Take out the oven and feast!! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Save this recipe and let me know if you give it a go ❤️ I’d love to know and see your recreations!! ✨ #vegan #plantbased #veganfood #veganlunch #vegandinner #veganmeals #mealideas #lunchideas #dinnerideas #veganrecpies #quarantine #quarantineandchill #covid #covid19 #fitness ✨🌿

🌿✨ Physique update, Ab workout, COVID - 19 and Training 👇🏼👇🏼👇🏼✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Firstly, id like to touch on my physique update before we get on to the hot topic right now, I’m feeling slightly fuller in parts of my bod as I’m still in the phase of transitioning between my bulking and shreddy kcals via reverse dieting (spoken about on my YouTube channel) Next week I’ll be going into my next phase, working towards my goals for this year! Nevertheless, I’m loving my workouts at the moment, hitting pbs and my current training split! I’ll be filming a FDOE video over the weekend to upload next week on my channel for the next chapter of my goals! ✨ Secondly, with many things going on in the world right now- I haven’t addressed it as it’s very draining! The best thing I would say is to be responsible for your own actions and stay assertive! ✨ Personally, I’m still training at my usual gym - your nutrition & exercise regime is vital for the strengthening of your immune system! So I would advise to stay active! Yes you don’t need a gym to stay active & there are other ways to employ exercise but that’s my preference - you go at your own risk! ✨ Understandably gyms can be a hub for infection but being hygienic - wiping down the surfaces and being clean after your sessions can reduce the risk of infection! ✨ A large number, are understandably self isolating and are using home workouts (as advised - I’m not saying to ignore) but I would also reassure you not to be afraid and be anxious about the whole situation! ✨ Everyone is in the same boat and I’m absolutely loving all the support I’m seeing as I scroll through the explore page! We can all help each other! What are your thoughts? ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Swipe for an ab routine I vouch for a killer core session - give it a go ✨ 3x10 - Hanging leg raises Ssw/ knee tucks, weighted jackknifes Ssw/ weighted sit ups, bench reverse crunches ❤️ wearing @pursuefitness sports bra and seamless thongs #gifted ✨ #training #fitness #covid19 ✨🌿

🌿✨ Dreamy views @dorsettcity Hotel over the weekend #giftedstay ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ After my ebook event, my boyfriend and I checked-in to the Dorsett city hotel in the heart of central London which was kindly gifted! As a Londoner myself, I’ve never stayed in a London hotel for obvious reasons! So I’ve not really appreciated the absolute beauty of London from a tourist aspect before! As I’ve lived here my whole life I know London really quite well, I’ve done the sites, theatres and all the other amazing ness that is London, but I’ve never experienced an overnight stay at a London hotel! At dorsett city, the hospitality, location and interior design was absolutely fabulous! We were greeted with smiles and cupcakes (not vegan though 🙃 I had the raspberries whilst my boyfriend hoovered up both pancakes)! Our room had a hallway with a work space, en suite bathroom and a mega view! They have a gym, 2 restaurants on sight and a beautiful room top bar which overlooks London’s beauty! 🌿✨ Miso grilled aubergine with rice noodles edamame and grilled sweet peppers 🤤✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ If there’s one thing I love!! It’s what you can do and how you can flavour vegetables to make them the centre of the dish! Aubergine is great to use in a main dish and flavour into something soo delicious! ❤️✨ I decided to use miso, as miso is rich in essential minerals and a good source of various B vitamins, vitamins E, K and folic acid. As a fermented food, miso provides the gut with beneficial bacteria that help us to stay healthy, vibrant and happy; good gut health is known to be linked to our overall mental and physical wellness! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📖 RECIPE: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 1tsp miso paste ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 1 tbsp agave nectar ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 5g coconut oil ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Some paprika, garlic and onion powder ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👩‍🍳 METHOD: mix the miso glaze ingredients together! Cut an aubergine in half and score with a knife! Brush the glaze on top and pop in the oven for 10 mins! Then, remove from the oven and pop under a electrical grill for 5 mins! Top with sesame seeds and serve with all the wonderful things! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Save this recipe, give it a go and let me know what you think ❤️ Have a fabulous day all! ✨ #vegan #plantbased #veganfood #veganlunch #vegandinner #veganmeals #mealideas #lunchideas #dinnerideas #veganrecpies ✨🌿

🌿✨ SUGAR FREE LEMON AND POPPYSEED BUTTER BISCUITS ✨ using @natvialiving #iamsugarfree #natvia #natviaambassador #ad ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ I am now working with @natvialiving to share with you guys recipes each month using their sugar free “sugar” range! I don’t believe sugar is the devil, you can of course have it within its limits, but we all know that sugar/ sugary snacks are quite high in calories and are better in smaller amounts!! Where as, when your making home made goods and re takes on classics on that Sunday funday baking afternoon you may have planned! You can make lower calorie alternatives- which means you can have more for less aka Volume 👏🏼 which is always what I prefer! ✨ Natvia products use stevia and erythritol extracts which are completely natural ... so they’re not considered artificial sweeteners, therefor don’t use any biotechnologist or GM in the production of their range! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📖 RECIPE - serves 10 (macros: 130kcals 10C 5P 8F) ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉🏼 100g spelt flour 👉🏼 30g vanilla protein 👉🏼 60g smooth peanut butter 👉🏼 50g @natvialiving sweetener 👉🏼 10g poppy seeds 👉🏼 3 tbsp lemon juice 👉🏼 5g flax seeds 👉🏼 1/2 tsp baking powder, some salt ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉🏼 Butter topping: 50g coconut spread, 10g @natvialiving sweetener, 2 tbsp lemon juice ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👩‍🍳 METHOD: mix all the ingredients for the dough and roll into a ball. Split the ball into 10 smaller balls. Flatten the smaller balls on a baking tray lined with baking paper. Make wells within the flattened pieces of dough. Pop in a pre heated oven for 15 mins on 180c. To make the lemon butter, mix the relevant ingredients. Take the biscuits out of the oven, leave to cool and top equal amounts of the lemon butter on top! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ ✨Save this recipe and let me know if you give it a go! ❤️ Swipe to see the range of Natvia products which I’ll be using within my cooking, coffees and teas! ✨ #vegan #plantbased #veganfood #health #healthyfood #desserts #foodie #veganfoodie #food #breakfast #vegansnacks #poppyseeds ✨🌿

🌿✨Vegan truffle macaroni no CHEESE with leeks mushrooms and courgettes 🤤 hows it possible to have no cheese in Mac and cheese ? 😅👇🏼👇🏼👇🏼✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ @momafoods kindly gifted me a bunch of their oat mills to try and challenged me to recreate one of their recipes!! The recipe looked amazing so I just had to 👏🏼 packed full of veggies, this mac and cheese is the perfect take on a classic favourite! Sooo yummy! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📖 RECIPE - serves 4 people: ⁣ 👉🏼250g Macaroni pasta ⁣ 👉🏼100g dairy free spread plus 1 tsp ⁣ 👉🏼150g mushrooms ⁣ 👉🏼1 leek⁣ 👉🏼1 onion⁣ 👉🏼1 litre oat drink @momafoods ⁣ 👉🏼85g flour⁣ 👉🏼1 1/2 tsp Dijon mustard ⁣ 👉🏼1 1/2 tbsp Nutritional yeast ⁣ 👉🏼 1tsp Truffle oil 👉🏼 20g bread crumbs, some Thyme and 1 clove of garlic ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👩‍🍳 METHOD⁣: 👉🏼Cook macaroni⁣ 👉🏼Melt the 1 tsp of dairy free spread in large frying pan and cook leek and mushrooms⁣ 👉🏼Make sure all the water has cooked off⁣ 👉🏼Peel and half the onion and place it in a small pan over a medium heat with oat milk⁣ 👉🏼Bring to the boil and then remove the onion⁣ Melt the remaining dairy free spread in another pan and add flour, stir continuously until it forms a paste⁣ 👉🏼Gradually add the warm milk and whisk until smooth ⁣ 👉🏼Bring to boil and simmer until thickened ⁣ 👉🏼Stir in mustard, truffle oil and nutritional yeast. Add salt and pepper⁣ 👉🏼Add the pasta and vegetables to the sauce⁣ 👉🏼Stir until all coated⁣ ⁣ 👉🏼 To make the breadcrumbs - grab a bread roll, whack it in the oven, until hard, take out the soft bread from the roll! Place the roll in the blender with a garlic clove and some thyme until all crumbed up! 👉🏼 Top with the breadcrumbs and pop in the oven for 15 mins to crisp and sizzzzzle 🤤 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Save this recipe, give it a go and let me know how you do ❤️ the oat milk is now out in @sainsburys ✨ #vegan #veganrecipes #veganfood #veganpasta #macandcheese #macaroni #oatmilk #dinner #lunch #recipe #plantbased ✨🌿

🌿✨ Homemade vegan enchiladas ❤️ ✨ some lunch time inspo for you guys this morning! ✨ Macros: 605kcals 75C 19F 29P ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Feeling much better today and I’m on en route manchester for a @myproteinuk event with the rest of the my protein familiaaaa! ✨ Promised you all that I’d share my vegan lunches and dinners more often rather than only sharing my breakfast (still remains to be my favourite meal everrrr) I love switching up what I’m having for my other meals and being creative with them too! Things like enchiladas, burritos, quesadillas and tacos are all fabulous and yummy ways to satisfy your hunger and meet your macronutrient requirements! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📖 RECIPE - serves 1: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉🏼 3 mini soft tortilla wraps ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉🏼 Filling: 100g pasata, 80g cooked soy mince (I get mine from the @tescofood basic frozen isle), 60g cooked black beans, red onion, garlic powder, salt, pepper and paprika ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉🏼 50g pasata ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉🏼 1 sliced avocado, coriander ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉🏼 50g Drizzle of unsweetened soy yogurt ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👩‍🍳 METHOD: prepare the filling by mixing all of the ingredients in a pot and heating! Distribute equal amounts into each wrap and roll! Place the rolls onto a baking tray/ oven proof plate and Pour on top the remaining pasata! Bake in the oven for 15 mins! Take out the oven, drizzle on the soy yogurt and top with the avo and coriander for extra deliciousness 👏🏼 enjoy! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Do we keep the vegan lunch/dinner inspo on my feed or?? ✨Save this recipe and let me know if you give it a go! ❤️✨ #vegan #plantbased #veganfood #health #healthyfood #brownie #desserts #foodie #veganfoodie #food #breakfast #dinner ✨🌿

🌿✨ PRESSURE ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ I can’t lie to you guys, I’ve had a bit of a low day today! ✨ I woke up today at 5am as per, had a good nights sleep, had my weetabix oatmeal pre workout meal, got ready and headed to the gym as planned! I don’t usually wear make up but I decided to for today because of the event I was meant to attend this evening! ✨Went to the gym, hit a leg session, it was a good session! I refreshened up and went straight to work! I don’t know what it was but I just felt physically drained which is not usually like me! Usually after a morning workout, I’m really quite energised and ready to start my day but it just wasn’t the case today! ✨ This evening I got invited to a PR event with @h2clubs in aid of their new gym opening, I was ready for a 45 min HIIT workout with other fitness bloggers ❤️✨ I was really looking forward to it! But for some reason, after I finished my shift at work and actually making my route to the event (quite close by to my workplace) I got off the bus and turned back to go home... I just had a mind fog and a bit of anxiety towards it! ✨ I just had one of those day today where I just needed to do a lot of breathing and stop overthinking things! ✨ it’s okay to take a break from things! If you’re having a down day just relax and take a moment to breathe! I don’t usually just bail out of things unexpectedly but today I did and that’s okay - I just don’t think going to an intense workout class after a mornings legs session, busy day at work and things on my mind was ideal for me today!✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ I have an event in manchester tomorrow which I need to leave early morning for, so I’m just going to really relax this evening and do some mindfulness! 🌿✨ Nutrition ✨ Do you find yourself constantly snacking or craving food? 🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ I’m sure you’re fully aware that the right nutrition leads to the most sustainable results! ✨ Without eating enough, you’re not going to go far with your progression! ✨Also, without feeding yourself with substantial meals, snacks and being hydrated throughout the day, you tend to crave food! ✨ Craving food shouldn’t be ignored in my opinion, If you fancy something, have it! Just have a portion size of it! ✨ However, I don’t find myself craving foods all the time because I make sure I’m eating foods high in volume and nutrition! ✨ Not only do I love the way I eat on a day to day basis, I’m not afraid to eat foods I wouldn’t usually because I fancy it or over social events✨ Other reasons you may be experiencing craving food all the time, may be because: 1️⃣ Not eating balanced meals: ensuring you’re getting an adequate amount of each macronutrients, is going to prevent you from constantly craving food! Each macronutrient is just as important as the other! 2️⃣ Irregular eating habits: try to keep your eating times as consistent as possible - obviously it’s not always possible but your bod likes to keep to a routine and consistency! 3️⃣ Lack of sleep: often, a lack of sleep can make you feel more hungry because your body is craving more energy! Sleeping recharges your bod and is sooo important when repairing muscle fibres and other processes in your body! 4️⃣ Food rules or restrictions: trying to stop yourself from eating foods you love, will make you want it more! Having it in small amounts - little and often/ when you like is better than taking it completely away from your diet! 5️⃣ Poor gut health: your gut flora plays a huge part of your digestion and even your mental clarity- ensuring you’re getting in a great source of probiotics will help balance your gut flora out! ✨Although I’m all about IIFYM and #BALANCE ✌🏼eating foods higher in nutrients, greater volume and more fulfilling, will always be more beneficial for you than constantly eating highly processed foods! ✨ Let me know what you think 👇🏼✨🌿

🌿✨ Brunch o’clock is the best time of the day no? ✨ @brunchandcake had my heart this morning with their warm carrot cake oats 🤤 it was such a lovely day today in barca! ✨The sun was out and we had brunch by the sea, what a way to start March! 👏🏼 I had the carrot cake oats with the peanut butter charcoal latter using coconut milk and we then halved the avo toast! ✨ you just can’t have brunch without some sort of avocado in toast can you! ✨ @armandocantore had the red velvet waffles! ✨ What would you of gone for? 👇🏼✨ #barcelona #flatlay #barceonafood #brunch #brunchspot #brunchandcake #vegan #plantbased #veganfood #foodie #foodies #carrotcakeoastill #breakfast #avocado #coconutbowl ✨🌿

🌿✨Being honest with you...✨ Dinner spot of dreams yesterday @honestgreens ✨ Definitely a must visit in barcelona! If I could I own my own cafe, it would be just like this one! ✨ loved their aesthetic, the bowls, the food ... especially the dessert 😍 ✨ For my mains I chose the kale and lettuce base with quinoa and chickpea croutons, added tofu with coriander and garlic sauce and maple roasted butternut squash! ✨ for dessert we halved each of the the plant based cauliflower brownie and ginger and miso cheesecake ✨ both so good 👏🏼🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨I cant type and lie to you, there has been thoughts (even on other trips) where I’ve just thought... I shouldn’t have a dessert after eating so much throughout the day already! ✨ yes I’m in a definite surplus this weekend but am I enjoying the time with my boyfriend and the foods that we’re having together 👏🏼 yassss ✨ Im not over doing it, because I don’t restrict myself day to day, I’m just having more than Id usually eat in a day because of the fact I’m dining out for each meal, where as my home cooked meals, would probably be as delicious but more volume for less! ✨ I know there are others that think the same way! And from my background of disordered eating, I always have those thoughts, but I don’t let it get to me anymore ❤️ I’m happy, enjoying my time and just lucky enough to be able to even have food to eat! ✨🌿

🌿✨ How will I manage my training around my work shifts? ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ I’ve had many questions recently asking how I manage training whilst doing 12 hour shifts! It’s usually from others who do shifts at work or other allied health occupations!✨When deciding to be a diagnostic radiographer and going through the course as a student, as well as being a fitness enthusiast, I realised that planning is essential! Planning and organising allows me to keep up with my target of training 5 times per week!✨ My work schedule is either shifts for 3 long days (8-8pm) 4 days off or normals 8-4pm, 8:30-4:30pm, 9-5pm, 9:30- 5:30pm, 10-6pm, 11:00-8pm, mon- fri per week! ✨A lot of the times I’m just doing normals and I can definitely manage to go gym before or after work! ✨ but when it comes to my shifts, I have to manage my time a bit more strategically to be able to fit in 5 times a week! ✨ Arguably I could just do 4 times full body on those weeks, but I love/ prefer the 5 times individual muscle group split! ✨ So for the 4 days I have off, I go to the gym for sure and on 1/3 of the long days I go to the gym before! ✨ which means I wake up at 4am for that particular day to give myself 2 hours to go to the gym - including stretching, mobility work and contingency! And then it takes me 40 mins to get to work by bus! ✨ Throughout my days, I ensure that I’m fuelling my body enough, drinking plenty of water and getting an adequate amount of sleep to balance my work and love for fitness! ✨ In terms of my leisure, I keep a diary of dates/times where I’m free to be able to hang out with friends and family! I also set time to create content for the gram to be able to engage with you all ❤️✨ I love my routine and I try to be as motivated as I can to stay on top of it all! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Do you do shifts at work? How do you manage your split! Let me know ❤️✨ Wearing @wearetala ✨ #fitness #fit #health #lifestyle #vegan #plantbased #sustainable #sustainability #workout #booty #😊 #wearetala ✨🌿

🌿✨CHOC PB CUP PANCAKES!! 🤤 Macros: 611kcals 61C 56P 16F (including toppings) ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ ITS PANCAKE DAY!! And probably the 500th pancake stack you’ve already seen today! It also means it’s sooo acceptable to have pancakes at every meal today 🙃🙃 I decided to top my chocolate peanut butter cup inspired pancake stack with one @myvegan choc peanut butter protein cup! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📖 RECIPE: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 70g spelt flour (you can use an alternative, just not coconut or almond flour) ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 30g @myvegan dark chocolate vegan blend protein ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 5g cacao powder, 5g chia seeds ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 1/2 a courgette ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 180ml unsweetened almond milk, 1/2 tsp of baking powder, a dash of salt and lemon juice ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ 20g @myproteinuk Powdered PB (it would work with normal peanut butter too, it would just alternate the macros) ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👩‍🍳 METHOD: heat a non stick pan on the hob! Blend all of the ingredients together except for the powdered PB and PB cup! Form the PB by mixing it with some water (keep it thick so use minimal water)! Place portions of the mixture on the hob! Take a teaspoon and place the formed PB on each portion of the pancakes, allow to cook on one and side and flip to cook on the other! Repeat, build your stack and top with a peanut butter cup 🤤 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Save this recipe and give it a go ❤️✨ lets just make it into a pancake week, because one day to appreciate pancakes, isn’t long enough 🙃 right? #pancakes #pancakeday #breakfast #vegan #plantbased #chocolate #veganpancakes #veganfood #breakfastideas #breakfastinsoo #peanutbuttercups #myvegan #myprotein #highprotein #bodybuilding #flexbowl #pancakestack #peanutbutter ✨🌿

🌿✨ FOOD TIMINGS?!✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ When’s the best time to eat breakfast, lunch and dinner? ✨ There’s no best time eat, however their are times where your body can optimally use the calories/ energy you’ve consumed, especially pre and post workout! ✨ You may of heard of “intermittent fasting” all it is, is an eating window for people that lifestyle suits it! It’s not a fast track to weight loss or anything of the kind! ✨ Fundamentally, however you choose to eat, weight loss and gain is dependent on your overall intake throughout the day! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉🏼Pre workout snack/ meal: Typically you want to have a meal high in carbs to provide the energy you require to be able to push through a workout! If you’re in a rush and you need something quick around 30mins before a workout, simple carbs are your go to! However, if you have time - which I usually make time for it, I’d have a meal/ snack high in complex carbs which is going to provide a slower release of energy maintained throughout the workout!! Fats also provide a long term source of energy, but that’s dependent on how your body facilitates it! Personally, my overall intake for the day is higher in carbs than fat, as my body is able to process carbs better than fat! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉🏼Post workout meal: You want to try and eat within 2 hours post workout to be able to replenish the muscle fibres broken during a workout! A meal high in carbs and protein is essential! During a workout, your body uses up its glycogen stores and results in your muscles being partially depleted of glycogen. Some of the proteins in your muscles also get broken down and damaged. After your workout, your body tries to rebuild its glycogen stores and repair and regrow those muscle proteins. By increasing carbs and protein post workout it helps decrease muscle protein breakdown, Increase muscle protein synthesis, Restore glycogen stores and Enhance recovery. Wearing @doyoueven @doyouevenwomen ❤️✨ #fit #fitness #bodybuilding #fitnessjourney #fitnessgirl #workout #teamDYE #vegan #plantbased #strong ✨

🌿✨Fitness update ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ It has been 6 months since I’ve started my “bulk” per say, where I have increased kcals above my total daily energy expenditure (TDEE) into a caloric surplus! ✨ I implemented a technique called reverse dieting, where by every two weeks, I opted to increase my kcals from my caloric deficit by 50kcals! By doing so, it allowed my body’s metabolism to adjust accordingly and in simple terms, not being shocked and not knowing what to do with the extra calories! ✨ Instead, by going slowly, my body adjusted and knew what to do with the extra kcals in correlation to my method of training and progressive overload! ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨Disclaimer: every BODY requires different amount of kcals to function, to be able to build and to be able to loose! I’m sharing my stats purely offf of the basis of reference and interest! ✨ currently I’m 2 weeks into a “shreddy” phase! I bulked up to 2100kcals and Im quite happy with the progress I’ve seen, particularly in my upper bod! I’ll also be using reverse dieting to lean out over a 12 week period - which is a sensible and achievable timeline - not a week like “fad diets” claim you can do sustainably!✨ 👉🏼Current weight: 45kg - I don’t weigh myself a lot because I find that it is a useless measurement as my body weight doesn’t really change much! Progression photos always 👏🏼 (I’m 5ft) 👉🏼Current calories: 2050kcals Current workout split: x5 per week, x3 lower bod, x2 upper bod, x3 core 👉🏼Current cardio routine: 1 HIIT session per week 👉🏼Current steps: 15-20k steps per day ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Last year, I found my shreddddy to be quite successful, and I was really happy with what i achieved (BTW, Yess I love to achieve aesthetic goals too! But I’m not obsessed with it, I just enjoy reaching a goal)! This year, I’m not going to go as low as I did previously! I’ll be doing these updates every 2 weeks to check in! I’ll also be doing a YouTube video to further explain the idea of reverse dieting and why it’s so useful! ✨ #fitness #fit #fitnessmotivation #fitnessjourney #DYE #🇬🇧 #😊 #bodybuilding #gym #workout #vegan #plantbased #highprotein ✨🌿

🌿✨Q&A 2✨ Wearing @doyoueven @doyouevenwomen ✨ new clothing releases coming 19th February ✨ Automated discount link in my bio ✨🌿✨Q1: How are you able to wake up so early to work out? A1: for me, I don’t find working out as a chore! I have a passion for it, and I think when you love something so much, you don’t even think about the difficulties of it! I don’t even find it hard to wake up at 5am, I’m so use to it, as my body alarm clock just wakes up at that time naturally! ✨ I get to sleep early (if my work schedule allows it) and have enough of it, I fuel my bod before I hit a gym sesh and I just get on with my day! It’s just the type of person I am! I like routine and I like structure! However, due to my work schedule, sometimes I’m not able to gym in the morning, so I factor that in and do it after work instead, even though I wayyyy prefer a morning workout! ✨ I’m a shift worker, so not every week is the same, but I find a way to structure each shift pattern to ensure I’m getting enough sleep and training because I love it! ✨Q2: The majority of your meals seem to be sweet like desserts - why not other sources of carbs? A1: I’m definitely a sweeeeet tooth kind of person but I do have normal lunches and dinners too, it’s just my feed is mainly breakfast based! If you’d like to see more of my lunches and dinners, let me know in the comments with “🙋🏻‍♀️🙋🏻‍♀️🙋🏻‍♀️✨ Q3: What helped you changed your mindset towards food to become more healthy? A1: it was a combination of friends and family, as well as other people online who were a positive influence and my personal development also! I’ve always been sooo interested in food, nutrition, health and fitnesss! At the start I was uneducated in terms of nourishing and fuelling my bod , but I kept reading around, as well as through trial and error which has lead to my understanding of a healthy sustainable way of eating! I no longer look for “shortcuts” I just know the fundamentals of being able to maintain, lose or gain weight through my diet without restrictions ✨ ✌🏼 In my next post, I’ll be updating you with my current stats including my body weight, kcals, steps +training split✨ #vegan #fitness #DYE #plantbased #😊 #🇬🇧

🌿✨ MY GO TO SNACKS! ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ For me, I need to snack! The time between breakfast and lunch, lunch and dinner is way too long for me not to eat! Typically, I like to have a pre workout snack, breakfast, another snack, lunch with a dessert, another snack and dinner with a dessert! ✨ To be able to have many snacks within the day, I’m allllll about volume so I make use of lower calorie options to be able to have more within the day so I don’t feel hungry for long periods of time during the day!! ✨ The type of snack I have depends on what time of the day I’m eating them, for example, typically my pre workout snack is higher in carbs to be able to fuel my workout and for my body to optimally make use of that macronutrient, where as snacks that I have earlier or later in the day may be higher in protein or fats to keep me satisfied and provide a longer term of energy throughout the day✨my go tos: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ Fave protein bars such as: @myvegan carb crusher, @myvegan red berry protein balls, @oatein millionaire shortbread squares, @nugonutritionuk choc pretzel sea salt, @phdnutritionuk toffee popcorn and @misfitshealth chocolate caramel protein bars ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 2️⃣ Chia pudding: typically 15g chia seeds mixed with 15g vanilla soy isolate, some almond milk and toppings ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 3️⃣ Unsweetened soy yogurt pot mixed with either a flavoured protein powder or a flavour drop - my faves are the toffee and white chocolate from @myproteinuk ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 4️⃣ Fresh fruit! Such as a banana, mixed berries ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 5️⃣ other faves: rice cakes/ crumpets topped with mashed banana or some kind of spread like @lotusbiscoffuk or @sweetfreedomuk choc shot or PB, @proper popcorn, @guruji_snacks lotus seeds, @soreenhq loaf bars, @livias nugglets, @indiebaysnacks dark chocolate covered pretzels ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ I also like to make my own high protein snacks such as brownies, muffins and cookies which can be found on my YT: Waffleswithleila ❤️✨Let me know what your go to snacks are? ✨ wearing @myproteinuk @officialmp ✨🌿

🌿✨ That Bop you do out of the gym when you BOSSS a session! ✨ Final set for Q&A from the previous questions asked on my stories!✨ ❤️✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨Q1: How many times a week do you recommend for beginners to gain muscle at the gym without being injured? ✨ A1: Typically Injury comes about when you over train! Whether you’re a beginner or not, you shouldn’t be over training or using weights with incorrect form! ✨ How many times you should work out depend on your lifestyle! If you can manage 6 sessions a week that’s great! If you can only manage 3, that’s just as great! You can adapt your training split for it to be the same intensity as those weeks where your workouts are more spread out in a week! Ie. Employ 3 full upper body days to be able to target each muscle group throughout the week! ✨⠀⠀ ✨Q2: How long were you training before you started to see change? A2: I would say it took a good 2-3 years to be able to see the muscle definition and body recomposition come about and for it to be maintained! ✨⠀⠀ ✨Q3: What should you eat in the morning before a workout? A3: whether it be in the morning or whatever time of the day, before a workout, it’s best to have simple carbs which are easily digestible and can supply energy for the period of time that you train for! It all depends on when you you’re having your pre workout/ meal which determines how many kcals you should have before. for example if you’re training in the morning, personally I eat 300-400kcals as a pre workout meal/ snack early, where as if it is later in the day where I’ve already consumed a substantial amount of kcals already I would have around 200-300 kcals as a pre workout snack just as a little pick me up! I don’t take any pre workout, I just use food for fuel and coffee, just not after 10am otherwise I won’t be able to sleep!✨⠀⠀ ✨Q4: How do you regain your period ? During my restricted eating , I lost my period for over a year because I was consuming too low of calories and overtraining in respect to that! To be able to regain your period, I would suggest reverse dieting and actively make an effort to fuel your body! ✨ #fitness #fit #doyoueven #gym #workouts #vegan

🌿✨If someone tries to take my squat rack....✨ Another set of Q&A from the previous questions asked on my stories!✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨Q1: “I’m really insecure about storing fat in my tummy” any tips on how to get rid of it? ✨A1: this is such a common question! If it’s not how to get rid of fat in one area of the bod, it’s “how do I tone” in a certain area of the bod and not the other! Well my friends, truth is, there’s no such thing! If you want to “tone up” it’s an overall loss of fat distributed throughout your body which is highly based on your genetics! However, with a training routine which focuses on all parts of your body, engaging all types of muscle groups, you’d be able to manipulate that! Also fat loss is a progression, it doesn’t happen by performing one ab movement!✨ Targeting and engaging all of your muscles when training is best advised, along with a calorie deficit over a period of time! ✨ ✨Q2: Are you going to bother dropping kcals over summer seeing as you’re already lean? ✨ A2: My vision of lean on my bod would be different to yours! Currently, yes I’m quite lean for the amount of kcals I’m consuming and in terms of how I feel, I feel great! ✨ I may decide to get a little shreddy for my hols, but currently I’m quite content with my physique now! I’m personally not ashamed to say I like to work for aesthetics aswell as feeling great when I’m working out! I love setting a goal and striving towards it! ✨ What I can say is that I won’t be decreasing my kcals as low as I’ve done previously as my metabolism has increased since then! ✨ ✨Q3: Does reverse dieting work? ✨ A3: 1000% yes! It’s a technique I employ when getting shreddy and building, for more info, I made a YouTube video separately about both processes! ✨ ✨Q4: is 2000kcals really the minimum amount of kcals women should be eating per day? ✨A4: In simple terms, no, no one has the same amount of kcals that they should be eating per day! Your kcals are going to be totally different to sally down the road! It’s based on your age, gender, genetics and lifestyle factors! You can workout your kcals according to your goals, on a number of nutritional calculators! ✨
