🌿✨ Q&A✨ Hello all! Since my previous question and answer did well, I thought I’d do them more often, and so I’ll be breaking it up into 3 separate posts, 4 questions each from the IGS I put on my story! ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨Q1: How often should you take progress pictures/ measure yourself ?✨ Firstly, you should realise that progress should be measured over a long period of time, not just a week! ✨ sustainable and maintainable results don’t happen over night! Therefore, I’d suggest taking monthly progress pictures! ✨ You can pot to use the scale if you want but personally I don’t find it to be a true reflection of your progress! Don’t be obsessed with the scale weight as your weight is dependent on your muscle: fat ratio! Your weight fluctuates, and so the scale doesn’t really account for that!Progression pictures, hip/waist measurements are a better form of measurements! ✨Q2: Do you do 15-20k steps on rest days aswell? What app do you use to track calories?✨ In a video I filmed for my YouTube channel “waffleswithleila” I shared my 2020 goals, one of them being to aim for 15-20k steps per day, I explained that my day to day job is quite active as it is so I usually surpass 10k without even trying! I do them on both rest and training days ✨Q3: How tall are you? How much do you weigh? ✨ Please appreciate my measurements are personal, don’t feel the need to compare yourself to me because it’s not going to help you in any sense, but I’m aware that people like to know for reference! I weigh 44kg and I’m 5ft small .. yes a tiny human! ✨Q4: How long after exercise should you eat? ✨ In a study conducted by some researchers, they measured the eating window that athletes/ bodybuilding competitors and the average joe going to the gym like me, should be eating between! ✨ they found out that it’s important for those training really intensely to get in an adequate amount of protein within the hour of training! However, those that just want to live a healthy lifestyle and all, don’t leave it further than 2 hours! ✨ personally I’m a hungry beast after the gym so I eat the minute I get home! The meal tends be high in protein and carbs to replenish my muscle! ✨

🌿✨ GIANT ONE SERVE STRAWBERRY JELLY TART 🍓 ✨ MACROS: 521kcals 53C 46P 3F✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ @myvegan have now come come up with a clear vegan blend!! 💦💦 Making it extra convenient to get your protein in! ✨ I know the concept of the clear vegan blend is to have as a drink, but me and my extranesss/ my love for breakfast, thought it would be fab to make a high protein jelly tart 🤤✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📖 RECIPE : ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉🏼 For the base: 50g spelt flour, 20g @myproteinuk vanilla soy isolate, 15ml almond milk, 20g unsweetened soy yogurt, 1/4c water! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉🏼 For the filling: 200ml water, 7g agar agar, 30g @myvegan clear strawberry vegan blend! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👩‍🍳 METHOD: for the base, mix the relevant ingredients to form a dough and place the dough into a skillet/ baking proof pan! Bake in the for 15 mins on 180c! Take out of the oven and leave to cool! In the meantime, prepare the strawberry jelly by mixing the water and clear vegan blend in a pot on a high heat, leave to boil, take off the job and add the agar agar! Pour the liquid onto the base and place in sliced strawberries! Leave to cool overnight and enjoy the following morning!! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ I always think breakfast/ cooking is a form of self love ❤️ if you make time for it, enjoy the meals and take time to eat that’s amazing! Use LHYMP and my affiliate link in my bio for 37% offf the new clear vegan blend!✨ #vegan #veganfood #veganbreakfast #skillet #breakfast #plantbased #mealideas #breakfastfood #highprotein #veganprotein ✨🌿

🌿✨ Roly poly Bake ✨ Macros: 470kcals 60C 11F 28P ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ Another one for the breakfast ebook! ✨ Breakfast for kings and queens everyday of the week 👑 For the jam I used my homemade chia jam recipe and topped the skillet with @alpro vanilla custard! ✨ I’ll take dessert for breakfast any day of the week please 👏🏼✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📖 RECIPE FOR THE CHIA JAM - serves 1: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉🏼 100g frozen raspberries ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉🏼 5g chia seeds ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👩‍🍳 METHOD: In a pot place in the frozen berries along with 2 tbsp of water, mix in the chia seeds and continuously stir until the raspberries are softened. Place a lid on the pot and Allow the chia seeds to soak up the liquid to form a jam. Take off the hob and leave to cool! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ I’m hoping to release my ebook in March 🤞🏼🤞🏼 and I’m super excited to share some new creative breakfast ideas!! I’ll be sharing some of the shots in the ebook as little teasers so stay tuned to see what’s in store 😅👀✨ #vegan #veganbreakfast #veganfood #breakfast #skillet #custard #veganmeals #highprotein #alpro #skilletbreakfast #breakfastideas #leilasbreakfast ✨🌿

🌿✨ A WEEK OF CORE WORKOUTS✨wearing: @doyoueven @doyouevenwomen ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ As mentioned previously, I train my core 3 times a week! Each week I change up my routine and incorporate different exercises, reps, Sets and the use of weights! If you perform the same exercises each week and don’t change anything, you won’t be able to stimulate change internally! Your body needs to be challenged in some way to be able to build, be refuelled and strengthen✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🏋🏻‍♀️ WORKOUTS (3 sets per exercise): ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ Plated sit ups x15 ✨Reverse crunches x20 ✨Plated Russian twists x30 ✨Scissors x20 ✨BB Leg raises x15 ✨Flutter kicks x20 ✨Plank- 30 secs ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 2️⃣ hanging leg raises x10 ✨Cable crunches x10 ✨Decline bench reverse pikes x10 ✨ Decline bench weighted crunches x10 ✨Decline bench weighted leg raises ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 3️⃣ Ab roll outs x10 ✨V sits x20 Leg raises x20 ✨Side toe taps x30 ✨Bicycle crunches x20 ✨Hollow holds - 30 seconds ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨Save this and Let me know if you give this workout a go!! ❤️✨ #workout #fitness #core #abs #coreexercises #abworkouts #exercise #fit #workouts ✨🌿

Place a lid on the pot and Allow the chia seeds to soak up the liquid to form a jam. Take off the hob and leave to cool! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🌿✨ Who else loves the PB&J combo? ✨ #vegan #veganbreakfast #brekafast #pb #peanutbutter #jam #PB&J #highprotein #protien #veganhighprotein #plantbased #breakfastidea #waffles #wafflesandwich #courgette #foodporn #☺️ ✨🌿

🌿✨ Q&A✨ yesterday, I asked whether there was anything you wanted me to touch on in a caption as I’m back home ✌🏼 there was a mixed bunch of questions, and so I decided to answer the most relevant ✨🌿 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨Q1: what’s your favourite cheat meal ✨ A1: there’s no such thing a cheat meal for me, I continuously eat foods I love and when I want it! I don’t have any rules when it comes to “good” and “bad” food, I just have an understanding that some foods are more nutritionally dense then others ✨ ✨Q2: On days you burn more kcals, do you eat more or the same kcals ✨ A2: when I have a set amount of kcals that I’ve been following for a while, whether it be a rest day, less or more active days, my kcals won’t change! I personally need the same amount of kcals to be able to recover on rest days and training days considering I train the amount of times I do!✨ I don’t track the amount of kcals I burn, I just track my macros and ensure that I’m giving my body what it needs to suit my training style ✨ ✨Q3: How to get back on track after a weekend away? Do you loose progress ✨ A3: 3-4 days away on a city break, especially when your being active in terms of the amount of walking you’re doing, is not going to do your progress any harm! ✨ Walking is still a form of physical activity ✨ I resume as normally the following day I’m back, Ie. I return to tracking my macros, I go back to my training routine, I ensure I’m drinking plenty of water and fuelling my body in the right way! ✨ it’s inevitable that I would of gained some water weight, but it’s not possible for me to have gained weight from fat from the 3-4 day’s I may of had a surplus of kcals or not ... I wouldn’t know because I didn’t track ✨ ✨Q4: Current training split ✨ A4: training x5 a week, x2 rest days! On the 5 days I train, I incorporate 3 lower bod days and a push and pull session, along with 3 core sessions a week and keeping my step count between 15-20k ✨ Not currently doing HIIT, but as the year goes on and my goals begin to change, so will my training split! ❤️ ✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀ 🌿Wearing @bouxavenue black seamless set from the @arabellachi Collab #gifted 🌿
